fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl.description: View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services

ListProjectsResponse.description:
A page of the response received from the ListProjects method.

A paginated response where more pages are available will have `next_page_token` set. This token can be used in a subsequent request to retrieve the next request page.

nextPageToken.description:
Pagination token.

If the result set is too large to fit in a single response, this token will be filled in. It encodes the position of the current result cursor. Feeding this value into a new list request as 'page_token' parameter gives the next page of the results.

When next_page_token is not filled in, there is no next page and the client is looking at the last page in the result set.

Pagination tokens have a limited lifetime.

projects.description:
The list of projects that matched the list query, possibly paginated.

The resource is partially filled in, based on the retrieval_options specified in the `retrieval_options` field of the list request.

abuseState.description:
The project abuse state. Reports whether any components related to the project have been flagged. Should be ABUSE_OK for a project that is in good standing.

This field is read-only.

appengineName.description: Name identifying legacy projects. This field should not be used for new projects. This field is read-only.

createdMs.description:
The time at which the project was created in milliseconds since the epoch.

This is a read-only field.

labels.description: The labels associated with this project.

lifecycleState.description:
The project lifecycle state.

This field is read-only.

projectId.description:
The unique, user-assigned id of the project. The id must be 6?30 lowercase letters, digits, or hyphens. It must start with a letter. Trailing hyphens are prohibited.

Example: "tokyo-rain-123" This field is read-only.

projectNumber.description:
The number uniquely identifying the project.

Example: 415104041262 This field is read-only.

title.description:
The user-assigned title of the project. This field is optional and may remain unset.

Example: "My Project"

This is a read-write field.

create.description:
Creates a project resource.

Initially, the project resource is owned by its creator exclusively. The creator may then grant permission to read or update the project to others.

appengineStorageLocation.description: The storage location for the AppEngine Project Valid options are defined in the StorageLocation enum in apphosting/client/services/api/admin.proto

createAppengineProject.description: If true, an AppEngine project will be created.

projectId.description: A reference that uniquely identifies the project. This can either be the Project.project_id or the Project.project_number. This is following the naming PRD at goto/project-naming-prd. The caller must be an owner of this project, and billing must already be disabled.

get.description: Retrieves a limited project metadata set, given any project identifier.

projectId.description: The unique identifier of a project.

list.description: Lists projects visible to the user.

maxResults.description: Maximum number of items to return on a single page.

query.description: A query expression for filtering the results of the request.

patch.description:
Updates the metadata associated with the project.

. This method supports patch semantics.

projectId.description: The unique identifier of the project to be updated.

A reference that uniquely identifies the project. This can either be the Project.project_id or the Project.project_number. This is following the naming PRD at goto/project-naming-prd. The caller must be an owner of this project.

update.description: Updates the metadata associated with the project.

projectId.description: The unique identifier of the project to be updated.
